docs.snippet: While N.H.L. teams take a break, some of their affiliates will play in the parent arenas, offering players a taste of the big time and fans a chance to see young talent....
docs.lead_paragraph: While N.H.L. teams take a break, some of their affiliates will play in the parent arenas, offering players a taste of the big time and fans a chance to see young talent.
docs.abstract: NHL teams are taking a break during Winter Olympics, allowing some of their minor league affiliates to play in NHL arenas, which gives players a taste of the big time and fans a chance to see young talent.

headline.main: During Olympics, Minor League Teams Gladly Borrow Vacated N.H.L. Ice
headline.print_headline: During Olympics, Minor League Teams Gladly Borrow Vacated N.H.L. Ice

docs.snippet: Today is Tuesday, Feb. 11, the 42nd day of 2014. There are 323 days left in the year....
docs.lead_paragraph: Today is Tuesday, Feb. 11, the 42nd day of 2014. There are 323 days left in the year.

docs.snippet: The subpoenas authorized by the New Jersey legislative committee investigating the George Washington Bridge controversy include records of state police helicopters during the four days of the closings in September....
docs.lead_paragraph: The subpoenas authorized by the New Jersey legislative committee investigating the George Washington Bridge controversy include records of state police helicopters during the four days of the closings in September.
docs.abstract: New Jersey legislative committee investigating controversial lane closings at George Washington Bridge authorizes 18 new subpoenas, including one seeking records that will show who was aboard state police helicopters during days of the lane closings in September; also votes that claims against self-incrimination by two former aides to Gov Chris Christie are insufficient and that they must turn over related documents.

headline.main: 18 New Subpoenas Authorized in Lane Closing Inquiry
headline.print_headline: New Subpoenas Issued in Bridge Inquiry, Including Request for Helicopter Records

byline.contributor: Kate Zernike reported from Trenton, and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Nate Schweber contributed reporting from Trenton.
byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

docs.snippet: Facing pressure from conservative challengers, several lawmakers who supported a plan to expand health insurance for the poor could change course....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facing pressure from conservative challengers, several lawmakers who supported a plan to expand health insurance for the poor could change course.
docs.abstract: Several Republican lawmakers in Arkansas, facing pressure from conservative primary challengers, are reconsidering their support for plan to use federal Medicaid expansion funds to buy private insurance for poor people; abrupt reversal, even as idea is gaining support in other states, could leave 83,000 people who have signed up so far without insurance.

headline.main: In Arkansas, ‘Private Option’ Medicaid Plan Could Be Derailed
headline.print_headline: In Arkansas, ‘Private Option’ Medicaid Plan Could Be Derailed
